hard_constraints.translation: Even if David de Gea arrives, Casillas will stay at Real Madrid.
hard_constraints.evidence: Sentence 1: "will stay ... even if David de Gea arrives"
hard_constraints.reasoning: "Even if" introduces a hard conditional commitment: arrival does not change the staying decision.

hard_constraints.translation: If Casillas will stay at Real Madrid, then he will not leave Real Madrid in the summer.
hard_constraints.evidence: Sentence 4: "will stay ... rather than leave ... in the summer"
hard_constraints.reasoning: Semantic incompatibility: staying at the club (in this context) rules out leaving in the summer.

hard_constraints.translation: If Casillas will leave Real Madrid in the summer, then he will not stay at Real Madrid.
hard_constraints.evidence: Sentence 4: "rather than leave" (stay vs leave contrast)
hard_constraints.reasoning: Mutual exclusivity: leaving the club contradicts staying at the club (same relevant time frame).

hard_constraints.translation: If Casillas will fight for the No. 1 position, then he will stay at Real Madrid.
hard_constraints.evidence: Sentences 3-4: "willing to fight" + "will stay and fight"
hard_constraints.reasoning: Text intent and common-sense: fighting for the No.1 jersey at Madrid presupposes remaining at Madrid.

hard_constraints.translation: If Casillas will fulfil his contract, then he will stay at Real Madrid.
hard_constraints.evidence: Sentence 6: contract fulfilment statement in the Real Madrid context
hard_constraints.reasoning: Fulfilling a club contract entails remaining with that club for the contract term (at least not leaving as described).

hard_constraints.translation: If Casillas will fulfil his contract, then a signed contract/commitment exists.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Semantic presupposition: one cannot fulfil a contract unless one has a contract/commitment.

hard_constraints.translation: If Casillas is not the starter, then he will have a commitment with the younger players.
hard_constraints.evidence: Sentence 9: "if I am not the starter, I will have a commitment with the younger ones"
hard_constraints.reasoning: Direct conditional from the quoted statement.

hard_constraints.translation: If Casillas is determined to help Real Madrid defend their Champions League title, then Real Madrid are the current title holders.
hard_constraints.reasoning: Common-sense/linguistic entailment: only the reigning champions 'defend' the title.

hard_constraints.translation: If Los Blancos will become the first team to retain the Champions League title, then they are current title holders.
hard_constraints.reasoning: To 'retain' a title, the team must currently hold it.
